Key Match Events: Cape Verde's Ryan Mendes converted a penalty two minutes from time to edge Mauritania 1-0
Mauritania goalkeeper Babacar Niasse conceded a penalty after bringing down substitute striker Gilson Benchimol
Pre-Game Insights: Cape Verde were confident against Mauritania, who upset Algeria in their last game to reach the knockouts for the first time
Post-Match Reflections: Losing coach Amir Abdou said 'it's sad for us, but we've had a great tournament. We missed a little experience, speed and continuity'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Cape Verde, with a population of about 600,000, will meet either Morocco or South Africa in the last eight on Saturday
Others: Mauritania had good opportunity from a 57th minute free kick when Aboubakary Koita's dipping effort flew towards goal and onto the roof of the net
They had an even better chance two minutes later as Amar Sidi Bouna fed Souleymane Anne who was clear on goal, but missed from close range with a left-foot effort
